content.description: Lil' Sumpin' is a gently overhanging splitter offwidth corner that if existed in the Calico Hills would probably be a classic.  Unfortunately it has been gathering dust in the Attic of Red Rock and now is a little unusual to seek out on its own.  That being said the quality is quite good, climbing challenging, and setting peaceful, if not just a little sandy.
content.protection: Something similar to #4, two #5, #6 and a couple IPA's. Think steep calf/knee crack.
content.location: Prominent white corner crack 2/3rds up the hillside and roughly across canyon from "A Nasty Gash"  Please reference photos and binoculars might be helpful before questing up the hill.

content.description: The Attic is a rarely visited area that is currently home to one established splitter offwidth, the line of "Lil Sumpin". Some other potentially interesting cracks exist in area, but to my knowledge have not been explored/climbed yet. If they turned out to be any good this would likely make the hike more worthwhile. This area is not on Windy Peak proper, but across canyon and is only organized here because of its access.
